page.title: 02Principal Features
page.content: The principal features of this area are the moors, the farms, the river, A59 road, the Priory, and the villages. The{moors}are over 200m above sea level. They consist of heather, bracken, rough grass. They are used for grazing sheep, and rearing grouse for shooting. The{farms}are dairy, beef production, and sheep. The{River Wharfe}flows from north to south along the eastern side of this block.It is a tourist attraction and people fish in it. The{A59 road,}a major trunk road, travels east and west along the southern side of this block. The{Priory}is the ruins of a medieval monastery. It is a tourist attraction. There are two{villages,}Bolton Abbey and Halton East.
